title: Kuvempu
summary: Kuppali Venkatappa Puttappa (29 December 1904 – 11 November 1994),[2] popularly known by his pen name Kuvempu// (listen) kuu-VEM-POO, was an Indian poet, playwright, novelist and critic. He is widely regarded as the greatest Kannada poet of the 20th century.[3][4][5][6][2][7] He was the first Kannada writer to receive the Jnanpith Award.[8]
